segments.content: . the goal is to clarify the relationships between primitives, foundations, and deductive practice . we have no asperations to philosophy .

"foundation" refers to a body of deductive practice, here mainstream deductive mathematics . a primitive foundation is a collection of primitives that is complete in the sense that no other primitives are needed . but a foundation is consistent if every chain of deductions produces a contradiction can be shown to have a logical error .

ve set theory was asserted around 1900, and it was widely accepted as standard . aristotlean mathematicians were having good success with set theory, says abraham robinson . by 1900, dederkind was using set-theoretic methods and terminology, he says .
. "object generators" are essentially the same as "functions" in nave set theory . x  g means "x is a set with a group structure"
